subject: Physical Activity
conditions: Activity meets or exceeds recommended guidelines
description: Higher physical activity reduces long-term health risk and claim frequency.

subject: Preventive Check-ups
description: Regular preventive check-ups lower the probability of high-cost claims.

subject: Nutrition
description: Balanced nutrition decreases chronic disease incidence and associated costs.

subject: Tobacco Use
description: Tobacco use significantly increases mortality risk and premium adjustment necessity.

subject: Alcohol Intake
conditions: Verified through self-report or medical test
description: Excessive alcohol intake correlates with higher accident and liver disease claims.

subject: Stress Levels
description: Chronic stress elevates risk for cardiovascular and mental health disorders.

subject: Body Mass Index
description: Body Mass Index outside healthy range predicts higher long-term healthcare costs.

subject: Sleep Patterns
description: Poor sleep patterns increase risk for metabolic and mental health conditions.

subject: Socioeconomic Status
conditions: Below median income or low education level
description: Lower socioeconomic status correlates with higher health risk and claim variability.

subject: Health Tracking Devices
description: Use of health tracking devices improves risk predictability and incentivizes healthy behavior.

subject: Premium Calculation
description: Premiums must cover expected claims plus administrative costs and profit margin.

subject: Risk Pool
description: Larger risk pools reduce volatility and improve predictability of claims.

subject: Enrollment Behavior
description: Adverse selection increases overall claim costs and requires pricing adjustments.

subject: Claim Behavior
trigger: Insurance coverage reduces perceived cost of care
description: Moral hazard leads to higher claims and must be mitigated through co-payments and deductibles.

subject: Medical Cost Inflation
description: Premiums must adjust to reflect rising healthcare costs due to inflation.

subject: Reserve Calculation
description: Present value of future claims depends on accurate discount rate assumptions.

subject: Loss Ratio
description: Loss ratio must remain within acceptable range to ensure profitability.

subject: Catastrophic Risk
description: Reinsurance is required to protect against catastrophic losses.

subject: Customer Profitability
conditions: Expected claims vs premium over time
description: Customer lifetime value must exceed acquisition and servicing costs.

subject: Solvency Requirements
description: Insurer must maintain required capital to meet solvency regulations.

subject: BMI Accuracy for Athletes
trigger: High BMI detected in physically active individual
conditions: BMI >25 but high muscle mass and regular exercise
description: BMI may incorrectly classify muscular, fit individuals as overweight, leading to inappropriate risk assessment.

subject: Mental Health Stigma
conditions: Previous therapy or medication for mental health
description: Mental health treatment history might indicate proactive health management rather than increased risk.

subject: Age Discrimination
description: Chronological age may not accurately reflect health status for active, well-maintained older adults.

subject: Genetic Predisposition Paradox
conditions: High genetic risk but preventive lifestyle adopted
description: Genetic predisposition awareness may lead to better preventive care, potentially reducing actual risk.

subject: Alternative Medicine Efficacy
conditions: Preference for alternative over traditional medicine
description: Alternative medicine usage might indicate health consciousness but could delay necessary conventional treatment.

subject: Overmedication Risk
description: High medication usage might indicate either severe health issues or over-prescribing by healthcare providers.
